Expertise

Expertise represents a Character's skill level in a specific activity. Expertise can be unlocked multiple times, each time selecting a different specialization. Expertise is a Skill that offers a Bonus on a specific Stat roll (this Bonus does not apply to Metapowered activations which use the same roll). With each level at this Skill, the Character must also select a specialization, as seen in the following table.

  1. You may be good at things, but certainly not an expert.

  1. You are a considered an expert, although you know well that there is still much more to be learned.

  2. You stand out in a group of your peers, and people recognize you as an expert.

  3. You are renown amongst your peers, some might even come to you when looking for advice.

  4. You are amongst the elite of the world at what you do, your natural talent in combination with how much you practiced turns you into a master of the subject.

  5. Very few others, if any, can rival your Expertise. You are a true guru; you have reached the pinnacle of your Skill.

Operation

With this Skill, a Character can operate tools, heavy machinery, use devices, and drive or pilot any vehicles. Higher levels at this Perk allow a Character to use more complex devices and drive or pilot marvels of technology.

  1. You can drive simple cars, use your cellphone and personal computer.

  1. You can use all modern gadgets, don armors of the past and drive all modern ground vehicles.

  2. You can operate all modern non-military sea vehicles.

  3. You can operate all modern non-military air vehicles, and all ground and sea vehicles of the past.

  4. You can operate all modern space vehicles and all military vehicles.

  5. You can operate any futuristic vehicle, gadgets, or armor.

Weapons

With the Weapons Skill, a Character has undergone training of armed combat of any weapon type, from melee weapons to firearms and explosives. Higher levels at this Perk offer access to more advanced weapons.

  1. You can equip knives, clubs, rocks, sticks, knuckles and other such mundane weapons.

  1. You can use all blunt melee weapons, thrown projectiles and handgun firearms.

  2. You are familiar with all types of modern bladed melee weapons, hurled projectiles and all SMG and Shotguns.

  3. You are familiar with all military equipment and weaponry, including all modern riffles, machineguns, and grenade explosives.

  4. You can use heavy ballistic projectile weapons of the past such as catapults, and also modern planted explosives.

  5. You can use all futuristic and experimental weapons of any kind as well as how to fire missiles of any kind.

This section will elaborate on how Players can accumulate and to spend Experience. Experience is a game currency that is given to Players by the Narrator at the beginning of each new Session. Players gain Experience through their roleplay and the actions their Protagonists accomplish in-game. Protagonists start with a starting amount of Experience their Players can spent to develop them. Unless the Narrator states otherwise, that amount is 1000 Experience.

Some One-Shot Sessions or Sagas may offer different amount of Experience, according to the story and the severity of the adversity the Coalition is about to face. When it comes to rewarding further Experience, can only be done during Sagas, or One-Shot stories which extend to additional Sessions. Purely One-Shot experiences shall award no Experience, and there will be no further development of the Protagonists.

Experience as a resource is Player-bound and not Protagonist-bound. All Experience gathered and spent by a Player during a Saga for their current Protagonist can be transferred to that Player’s next Protagonist in case of an untimely death of a Protagonist or in case a Player wants to abandon their current Character and create a new one.

For more about new Protagonists, see @UUID[.bjWMvlWDwsU319DF]{New Characters}

For more about a Protagonist's death, see @UUID[Compendium.metanthropes.welcome.JournalEntry.8tVVlGzZE4KriD12.JournalEntryPage.RJ71fneUufIAxRMZ#death]{Death}

Awarding Experience

The amount of Experience awarded to each Player by the Narrator at the beginning of each new Session is based on the performance of the Protagonists and the events their Protagonists experienced during the last Session. The categories on which upon awarding Experience are based are the following: Roleplay, Acting, Goals, Adversity, Discovery, Influence. Those criteria are explained in detail in the segment below. The Experience awarded increases with the passing of each Session played. The specific amount of Experience awarded is ultimately based at the Narrator’s discretion.

  1. Roleplay: Roleplaying who your Protagonist is. Considering not only a Protagonist's general concept, Background, Metamorphosis, Arc and Regression but also the Character's ideologies, morals, code of conduct, childhood, ambitions, goals, fears, regrets, trauma, dreams, conscious and subconscious decisions and finally the in-game experiences that molded the Protagonist after the beginning of the story.

  2. Acting: Embodying your Protagonist. Changing the voice, tone, way of standing, mannerisms, eccentricities, idiosyncrasies, quirks, and any intense and memorable performances. The more distinct is the line between in-game and out-of-game the more Experience is awarded.

  3. Goals: Setting new goals and striving to succeed them. Laying detailed plans on how to archive them and working towards achieving them. There are personal goals for each Protagonist, and collective goals all members of a Coalition are striving towards. Setting serious goals is important, but ultimately more Experience is awarded when achieving them.

  4. Adversity: Confronting and overcoming challenges. Facing and overcoming adversity in form of a Character's phobias or Antagonists, and dealing with daring and life-threating situations. Recklessness without reason, winning or surviving out of pure luck, masochistic and self-destructive behaviors should not be equally rewarded with facing true adversity.

  5. Discovery: Exploring new landscapes and ideologies. Discovering more about the Cosmos and the world the Protagonist lives in, meeting new important Characters, encountering the use of new Metapowers, visiting new lands or new Dimensions, meeting new ideologies, learning new lore, disillusioning old lies, unraveling plots and demystifying the veil of the unknown.

  6. Influence: Change the world, and the lives of the people who live in it. Influencing the world by changing mindsets of other Characters, overpowering old regimes, altering the reality and worldview of others, bringing down systems and raising new ones, inspiring revolutions, and synthesizing new philosophies, ideologies, and beliefs.

Spending Experience

Experience can be spent to unlock new Metapowers and Perks, progress them to higher levels, and to advance Characteristics or Stats. Players can spend this Experience to progress their Protagonists before the first Scene of the new Session begins. Alternatively, Players can choose to store their Experience for later use. Narrators can progress their NPCs in a similar way that Protagonists do, or follow any other alternative method of progression.

Progressing Characteristics

Characters can progress their Characteristics by spending Experience. When progressing Characteristics, a Player is progressing their Protagonists base Characteristic. The base Characteristic is equal to their starting number of that Characteristic, plus any previous progressions by spending Experience. Base Characteristic do not include any increases from any type of Buffs, or decreases from any type of Conditions. The cost of progressing a Characteristic is equal to: The Characteristic’s base score * 10. Each progression increases the Characteristic by + 5%. A Character can progress the same Characteristic up to five times total.

Progressing Characteristics

My Soul is at 10% and I want to progress it. I must spend 10 * 10 = 100 Experience. My Soul Characteristic now becomes 15%. I want to progress it one more time, and now the new cost is 15 * 10 = 150 Experience, and my new score would become 20%.

Progressing Stats

Characters can progress their Stats by spending Experience. When progressing Stats, a Player is progressing their Protagonists base Stat. The base Stat is equal to their starting number of that Characteristic (which includes the base from the Stat's Characteristic), plus any previous progressions by spending Experience. Base Stats do not include any increases from any type of Buffs, or decreases from any type of Conditions. The cost of progressing a Stat is equal to: The Stat’s current score * 3. Each progression increases the Stat by + 5%. A Character can advance the same Stat up to five times total.

Progressing Stats

My Perception is at 35% and I want to progress it. I must spend 35 * 3 = 105 Experience. My Perception Stat now becomes 40%. I want to progress it one more time and now the new cost is 40 * 3 = 120 Experience, and my new score would become 45%.

For more about Characteristics and Stats, see @UUID[JournalEntry.8tVVlGzZE4KriD12.JournalEntryPage.iyhYr3JaNDadAp9F]{ Characteristics & Stats}

Progressing & Unlocking Perks

Characters can unlock new Perks or progress their existing ones by spending Experience. The cost for unlocking new Perks and progressing Perks is 100. Progressing Perks once the story has began requires in-game training time. Non-newly created Characters, without the aid of Metapowers, cannot learn new skills and knowledges overnight. Once the Saga has begun, Characters need to spend time in-game learning their new Perks in addition to spending Experience for them.

Progressing Perks

I want to unlock a new Perk for my newly created Protagonist. The Experience costs for unlocking that Perk is 100. During a downtime, I want to progress that Perk to level 4, doing so requires an additional 300 Experience.

For more about Perks and the time required training, see @UUID[.bI8yBqlTn7fl7H6S]{ Perks}

Prime Metapower

The very first Metapower a Metanthrope unlocks is considered the Metanthrope’s Prime Metapower. The act of the Metanthrope’s Metamorphosis unlocks the first level of the Prime Metapower for free. The Prime Metapower modulates game progression, as a Character cannot obtain any Metapower at a level beyond that of their Prime Metapower.

Each Metapower has a Classification and an Energy Type. There are ten Classifications (Aegis, Controller, Animator, Manipulator, Arbiter, Clairvoyant, Cosmonaut, Kineticist, Hammer and Utilitarian) and four Energy Types (Cosmic, Elemental, Material, Psychic). The experience costs of unlocking and progressing additional Metapowers beyond one's Prime Metapower differ according to the Classification and Energy Type of a Metanthrope’s Prime Metapower. Each Classification matches with two neighboring and synergizing Classifications. Two identical Classifications are also considered to be matching with each other. All other Classifications are considered non-matching. Metapower Energy Types can be the same or different.

Progressing & Unlocking Metapowers

When unlocking a new Metapower or progressing a current one, the Player must check the Classification and Energy Type of the new Metapower compares to the Prime Metapower’s Classification and Energy Type. One exception is the Classification: Utilitarian. This special Classification considers only the Energy Type of other Metapowers and has reduced Experience costs. Summing up all possible combinations between matching and non-matching Classifications and same or different Energy Types, as well as including the special costs of the Utilitarian Classification, six different Experience cost Tiers are created, as seen in the following table.

  • Tier 1: The new unlocked or progressing Metapower has the same or matching Classifications with the Prime Metapower, and the same Energy Type.

  • Tier 2: The new unlocked or progressing Metapower has the same or matching Classifications with the Prime Metapower but has a different Energy Type.

  • Tier 3: The new unlocked or progressing Metapower is the Utilitarian Classification, or the Prime Metapower is Utilitarian Classification, and the new unlocked or progressing Metapower has the same Energy Type.

  • Tier 4: The new unlocked or progressing Metapower is the Utilitarian Classification, or the Prime Metapower is Utilitarian Classification, but the new unlocked or progressing Metapower has a different Energy Type.

  • Tier 5: The new unlocked or progressing Metapower has a non-matching Classification with the Prime Metapower and the same Energy Type.

  • Tier 6: The new unlocked or progressing Metapower has a non-matching Classification with the Prime Metapower but has a different Energy Type.

Unlocking a new Tier 1 Metapower

My Prime Metapower is Meta Strength which has Classification: Hammer and Energy Type: Material. I want to unlock the Metapower: Invulnerability which has Classification: Aegis and Energy Type: Material. Since the Classification is matching and the Energy Type is the Same, the Tier for unlocking my new Metapower is Tier 1, and the Experience cost is 1000.

Progressing a Tier 6 Metapower

My Prime Metapower is Meta Strength which has Classification: Hammer and Energy Type: Material. I want to advance the Metapower: Telepathy which has Classification: Manipulator and Energy Type: Psychic from level 1 to level 2. Since the Classification is non-Matching and the Energy Type is Different, the Tier for progressing is Tier 6, and the Experience cost is 250.

Progressing a new Tier 3 Metapower

My Prime Metapower is Meta Strength which has Classification: Hammer and Energy Type: Material. I want to advance the Metapower: Meta Touch which has Classification: Utilitarian and Energy Type: Material from level 2 to level 3. Since I am progressing a Utilitarian Metapower with the same Energy Type, the Tier for progressing is Tier 3, and the Experience cost is 660.

Welcome to the world of Tabletop Role-Playing Games (TTRPGs), where interactive, story-driven adventures come to life. In a TTRPG, the Players aren’t just passive observers. Instead, they become the Protagonists of an evolving story, shaped by their actions and decisions. A story orchestrated by one among them called the Narrator. The Narrator sets the mood and tone with their descriptions and the roleplay of the NPCs (non-Protagonist Characters). The Narrator and the Players collaborate, crafting a tale that springs from the collective imagination of everyone involved. Unlike traditional games, there are no winners or losers in a TTRPG. The goal is for the Group (both Players and Narrator) to immerse themselves in a world they created a world that, while bound by certain rules, encourages unrestricted imaginative play.

Think of the dynamic of a group playing Metanthropes like this: the Narrator is the screenwriter, the director, and the entire supporting cast of a series. The Players, become the Protagonist: the star of the show. But there are no scripted lines or directions for them. They are free to do whatever they want, and the Narrator adapts the story based on their actions. The Narrator sets the scene, describing the environment, the mood, the setting, and the Characters involved. Then, it's up to the Players to drive the story forward. They interact with other Characters, the environment, and the world around them. They are responsible for their Protagonist’s inner thoughts and how they translate into dialogue and actions. The Narrator controls the dialogue and actions of all NPCs, including the Antagonists (NPCs who antagonize the Protagonists).

Roleplaying in Metanthropes is the act of embodying the role of another Character, bringing them to life within your Group. There's no right or wrong way to do it. Each Group can develop its own style of roleplaying, tailored to their interests and preferred pace and intensity of the game. The game unfolds as Players and Narrators engage in collaborative storytelling, improvising on the spot to create a truly unique narrative. Each story is forged by the preferences of the Group, and the level of commitment and involvement is entirely up to each Player. Each Player should find the level of participation and preparation that triggers their enthusiasm and excitement the most and be vocal about it to their Group. Roleplay can range from an amusing form of entertainment to a transcendental, emotional journey of self-discovery. Let your imagination take over and be inspired to act out scenes, adding greater depth and meaning to the storyline.

Transitioning into your Protagonist is an important process that helps the entire Group stay "in-Character". Once the flow of roleplay begins, Players are advised to jot down any non-urgent, out-of-game questions or notes and save them for the next pause, to avoid disrupting the game flow. Players can ask in-game questions to the Narrator, such as what they see around them, or if their Protagonist has knowledge of the subject that is in question in-game. The Narrator should provide all necessary information, and then resume the Narration.

The Narrator's role within the Group is multifaceted and distinct from that of the Players. While Players create and roleplay a single Character, the Narrator breathes life into a multitude of NPCs, and the entire Cosmos. The Narrator also sets the pace of the Session and often acts as a referee or judge to resolve in-game or out-of-game disputes. The Narrator's primary focus should be on the story and the Players. They are tasked with ensuring that the spotlight is distributed equally among the Protagonists. Narrators should always build, develop, and deliver their stories without bias or favoritism towards the Players or their Protagonists. Each Player, in turn, must respect their fellow Players' moments in the spotlight.

It's crucial for all Players to understand that the dynamic between them and the Narrator is not competitive. Additionally, both Players and the Narrator must respect any topics or contexts that have been designated as off-limits by any member of the Group. Such no-go zones could be any topic or context that makes any member of the Group uncomfortable.

Every Narrator brings something unique to the table. Some may excel in dramatic roleplay performances, while others shine in creating action-packed tactical scenarios. Some may struggle with intricate plots but excel in improvisation. If you're a Player considering the role of the Narrator, remember that you'll only discover your unique talents by giving it a try.

At the heart of each story are the Metanthrope Protagonists. The very essence of the word "Metanthrope" originates from the Greek term "Μετάνθρωπος" which translates to "beyond human." These remarkable beings embody the dichotomy between humanity and something more. What sets them apart from ordinary humans are their Metapowers — unique, metaphysical gifts that transform them into something extraordinary. Yet, even with their newfound abilities, Metanthropes remain tethered to the frailties, passions, and flaws of their human nature. In a Session of Metanthropes, Players will embody the transformative journey of an ordinary human who becomes a being of limitless capabilities. The game poses the question: What would you do with such incredible power?

Anyone, anywhere in the world, regardless of their age, gender, or background, has the potential to become a Metanthrope. All Metanthropes possess an innate ability to learn new skills and knowledge at an extraordinary pace, while their physiology undergoes remarkable transformations. Elderly Metanthropes are rejuvenated, granted a breath of youth that defies the passing of time. On the other hand, younger Metanthropes mature at an accelerated rate, acquiring wisdom beyond their years.

Unlike other supernatural beings of other works of fiction, Metanthropes are not limited by any external source, such as an energy pool, magic, mana, spell slots, or their own vitae. Instead, their only limits are bound by their psychosynthesis and the possibility of some Metapowers backfiring. This grants them the freedom to use their powers as many times as they see fit, with no arbitrary constraints. Metanthropes can harness their Metapowers until they have accomplished their goals and fulfilled their deepest desires. Each Metanthrope is part of a grander destiny, a bigger picture that unfolds before them.

Once ordinary individuals like you and me, Metanthropes undergo a profound transformation known as the Metamorphosis, which bestows upon them metaphysical abilities called Metapowers. This Metamorphosis can occur at birth, or at any point during their human lives. The manifestation of Metapowers can be triggered by a variety of factors, ranging from encoded genetic traits that activate at a certain age, to establishing a psychic connection with beings from other Dimensions or uncovering the secrets hidden within the depths of the ocean.

Metapowers, in their remarkable diversity, emerge without bias, often bestowed upon individuals with antithetical personality traits and abilities. It is not uncommon to witness an elderly person harnessing the strength to effortlessly lift a car, or a once fearful individual developing an indomitable will. Social outcasts find themselves transformed into inspiring leaders, while those of high-status risk tarnishing their public image through the misuse of their newfound powers.

These powers defy the laws of reality, allowing for the control of gravity, telepathic communication, miraculously curing all wounds, creating duplicates of yourself, among other magnificent abilities. As a Metanthrope, your journey will be characterized by exploration, discovery, and the continual unlocking of the extraordinary within.

The formation of a Metanthrope society weaves together the complexities of their shared world. The ebb and flow of Metanthropes, their presence known or hidden from humanity, the advancement of technology, and myriad other factors intertwine to shape the bonds and social dynamics among them. Some Metanthropes have never encountered another of their kind, while others remain unaware of their own innate Metapowers. Fear of exposure may drive some Metanthropes to avoid any suspicious interactions, concealing their secret abilities from the world. However, there are also those who actively seek to connect with fellow Metanthropes, yearning for the bonds of community. Together, they aspire to unite their gifts and ideas, exerting influence and driving change on both societal and individual levels.

Coalitions

Within the world of Metanthropes, the power of unity is realized through the formation of Coalitions. A Coalition is a group of Metanthropes who work together, synergizing their Metapowers and ideas to become a force to be reckoned with, capable of shaping the world itself. While individual Metanthropes can accomplish remarkable feats, the true potential of their abilities is magnified within the collective might of a Coalition. By joining forces, a Coalition enhances the individual capabilities of each Metanthrope, compensates for weaknesses, opens new avenues for problem-solving, and unlocks hidden potential.

Factions

As Coalitions grow in strength and influence, multiple Coalitions can unite to form a Faction. Factions are forged by shared doctrines, visions, common goals, ideals, or under the guidance of a unified leadership. These Factions may operate across multiple locations, spanning the planet, exoplanets, Dimensions, and even across multiple Timelines. Collaboration and communication between Factions have the potential to shape the Metanthrope status quo in profound ways. This vibrant ecosystem of Factions creates a delicate balance between unity and dissonance, shaping the future of Metanthrope society according to their unique vision. Amid the multifaceted realms of politics, philosophy, and power dynamics, the fate of Metanthropes, and the world hangs in the balance, as alliances form, rivalries ignite, and the eternal quest for a unified front unfolds within this intricate landscape.

Themes within this “Setting-Flexible” game are as diverse as the imagination of the Group, allowing for a fluid and adaptable storytelling experience. While the possibilities are limitless, the main theme that is explored in this Zine is the esoteric journey of discovering the extraordinary within and the introduction to a vast, greater cosmos. There are four recurring themes that tend to emerge during a Metanthropes story, shaping the narrative and driving Character development.

Metamorphosis

The transformation from an ordinary human into an extraordinary being is a central theme in Metanthropes. Each Metanthrope experiences their Metamorphosis differently, ranging from traumatic or life-altering events to awe-inspiring moments of self-discovery. This theme explores the impact of this pivotal transformation on their identity, beliefs, and path in life, shaping the very essence of their existence.

As Metanthropes grapple with the aftermath of their Metamorphosis, they face a journey of self-discovery and self-acceptance. This theme explores their personal growth, as they learn to harness their newfound powers, confront their fears and limitations, and find their place in a world that may view them as both saviors and threats. The Metamorphosis is not just a physical transformation; it is a profound exploration of identity, inner strength, and the potential for both greatness and fallibility.

Metanthropes and the World

This theme delves into the complex relationships between Metanthropes and the world around them. It explores the implications of revealing their existence to humanity and the subsequent conflicts that may arise. Metanthropes have the power to influence and shape their environment, raising questions about the balance between coexistence with humans and the potential consequences of their actions. Will their interactions with humans, nature, and animals lead to harmony or chaos?

Beyond the conflicts and implications of revealing their existence, this theme delves into the ethical dilemmas that Metanthropes face. Metanthropes must wrestle with the consequences of their actions and the potential impact on the delicate balance of the world. It is a theme that explores the price of power, the nature of morality, and the complex interplay between individual agency and collective welfare.

Metanthrope Community

The interactions within Metanthrope society form another recurring theme. The composition and locations of Metanthrope Coalitions on the planet create opportunities for collaboration, cooperation, or conflict. Stories may revolve around the personal connections of a small group of Metanthropes or explore larger Metanthrope civilizations with established governments, ideologies, and histories. The theme of Metanthrope society delves into questions of unity, dissonance, power dynamics, and the implications of Metapowers on the social fabric.

Within Metanthrope society, there are struggles for power, ideological clashes, and tensions arising from diverse perspectives. This theme delves into the intricacies of Metanthrope relationships, highlighting the alliances, rivalries, and personal dramas that unfold within their ranks. Metanthropes must navigate the complexities of trust, betrayal, and loyalty as they face internal conflicts that mirror the external challenges they encounter. It is a theme that explores the dynamics of community, the quest for identity and belonging, and the ever-shifting balance between unity and individuality.

Other Metapowered beings

Metanthropes are not the only Metapowered entities out there. This theme explores the interactions between Metanthropes and other Metapowered beings, such as extradimensional Spirits, extraterrestrial entities, and other otherworldly Metapowered forces. Encounters with these NPCs can shape the narrative, introducing unique challenges, alliances, and cosmic mysteries. Stories may unfold within the confines of a single city on Earth or explore the rich intergalactic histories of alien civilizations.

The interactions between Metanthropes and other Metapowered beings give rise to far-reaching consequences. This theme explores the profound encounters with ancient entities and civilizations existing beyond the bounds of human comprehension. Metanthropes venture into uncharted territories, where the boundaries of reality blur and the fabric of existence bends. It is a theme that delves into existential questions, metaphysical explorations, and the pursuit of knowledge and understanding in the face of the unfathomable.

Unleash your imagination with Metanthropes, a new setting-flexible, d100 TTRPG that embraces classless progression and boundless creativity. With 100 Metapowers and over 500 unique abilities at your fingertips, possibilities are limitless, shaped only by the stories you choose to tell.

Dive deep into tactical combat, probe the delicate balance of morality and the price of power, discover new Dimensions, engage in inter-Timeline espionage, orchestrate high-octane action sequences, and explore the very hinges of consciousness. 

Because in the end, it’s not about the Metapowers of our game -
it’s about the Metapowers it awakens in you.

Metanthropes is in Early Access, meaning that some features are still not fully developed, art is not finalized and/or missing & some existing features still lack polish.

We are incorporating your feedback, so please continue to share your thoughts with us on our Discord or any of our social media channels.

Follow our System @UUID[Compendium.metanthropes.install-system.LtDAG4iDlxFwGo8N] (Narrators/Gamemasters only) to enable the content that is included with the Metanthropes System & see the below Showcase for more!

Demo Showcase

Metanthropes comes with a demo where you can try out these features:

  • Responsive Character Sheet: Resize your Character Sheet and have it alter the amount of information displayed based on the available window width. Use the header buttons for some pre-configured layouts.

  • Informational Tooltips: The majority of the UI has informational tooltips that will explain and showcase available options when you mouse over

  • Roll Stats: Click on the Stats Page of your Character Sheet and click on any of the Stat Scores to roll that Stat, taking into account all Buffs, Conditions and Effects applied to your results. Right Click to Customize the Roll circumstances.

  • Re-Roll with Destiny: Click on the 'Spend Destiny to Reroll' button on the Chat to automatically deduct a Destiny Point and reroll the last roll, keeping all previous Bonuses and Penalties.

  • Activate Metapowers: From the Metapowers Page of your Character Sheet, click (or right-click) on the Metapower Icon to roll and then click on the 'Activate Metapower' button on the Chat to roll the effects for that Metapower. Click on the Name of that Metapower instead, to see more information in a separate sheet.

Coming Soon™

These features are currently in development and will be part of the Metanthropes System soon™

You may read the latest Development Blog on our website & catchup on our Milestone progression and v1 Release plan on GitHub.

  • Accumulating Levels of Success: Metapowers & Possessions will increase the impact of the activated effects, based on the total Accumulated Levels of Success.

  • Spending Levels of Success: Following a successful activation, you will be able to spend your Accumulated Levels of Success to drastically increase the impact of your Metapowers.

  • Automated Damage, Healing & Active Effects: Activating Metapowers and using Possessions will apply the damage or healing automatically to the selected targets and also apply or remove Buffs, Conditions and Active Effects as required.

  • Use of Measured Templates: Leverage Foundry's Measured Templates feature to help with auto-targeting within the area of effect of a Metapower or Possession.

  • Automated Audio & Visual Effects: Activating Metapowers and using Possessions will trigger Visual & Audio effects.

  • Official 3rd Party Module Support: We will be officially supporting the best 3rd Party Modules from the amazing community of Foundry Developers.

  • Upcoming v13 Support: We are working on refactoring our codebase to support Data Models and AppV2, include Scene Region Automations & the other upcoming features of Foundry VTT version 13.

Premium Modules for Foundry VTT are available on our website!

We are currently offering 3 Premium Modules for Foundry VTT:

  • Metanthropes: Introductory is a one-shot story with an amazing Opera map, premade Actors & Journals, to help new players learn how to play the game and to introduce them to the setting of Metanthropes.

  • Metanthropes: Core is the way the game is meant to be played, allowing for Character progression & providing access to over 500 unique abilities for your Protagonists.

  • Metanthropes: Homebrew allows you to tinker with the game rules, customize the Core content to your liking & create your own.

Launching February, as part of Zine Quest 2025, Metanthropes: Anthologies will include:

  • 3 Zines (physical / digital) & 3 Premium Modules for Foundry Virtual tabletop

  • 3 Unique Maps with Variations & 20 Tokens, including animated

  • Content Creation Backer Exclusives

  • Livestreams, Actual Plays & Live Backer Interactions

 Join us for three unforgettable weeks starting February 4 2025.
